title: This Artist’s Treehouse Is Changing How We See Tiny Homes
description: In an episode from Tiny House Giant Journey, a YouTube channel dedicated to unique home tours, host Jenna visits the Black Crane Treehouse, a striking, mid century-inspired retreat perched in the treetops above Mission Lake in Washington State. Designed as an artist residency, this small but highly intentional space blends architecture, craftsmanship, and nature into one unforgettable experience.
author: Erin

title: From abandoned to dreamy: see inside this Mexican home’s spectacular makeover
description: In the heart of Mérida’s historic center in Mexico, an abandoned structure has been quietly transformed into a serene retreat. Designed by Veinte Diezz Arquitectos, Vistalcielo is a 155 m² vacation home that reimagines the rhythm of indoor and outdoor living. Through a careful balance of preservation and modern intervention, the house invites light, air, and calm into every corner.
author: Erin

title: A Maui Home Blends Modern Minimalism With Climate-Conscious Design
description: A compact home in Maui by Hawaii Off Grid blends modern minimalism with climate-conscious design, featuring a sculptural roof and timber construction.
author: Caroline Williamson

title: HOCH & CHHO Transform a Former Hotel Into a Bold Tourist Residence
description: A former hotel in Paris' Montmartre is reimagined into bold tourist rentals by HOCH & CHHO with a postmodern and pop-laced sensibility.
author: Caroline Williamson

title: Hibrew Coffee and Cuisine / Simpul Studio
description: Hibrew Coffee and Cuisine is a renovation project of an existing coffee shop that has been operating for over six years. Located within a residential area, the building initially resembled a traditional house. The client envisioned a comprehensive transformation—both interior and exterior—to create a more contemporary and inviting atmosphere while maintaining the intimate familiarity of the original setting.
author: Miwa Negoro

title: Sonoro House / SANTOS BOLIVAR
description: Sonoro is a project that intertwines architecture and music from its inception. More than just a built space, it is a synesthetic work, a habitable instrument where rhythm, scale, proportion, and silence are translated from the staff to the plane.
author: Valentina Díaz
